answer: Elephants are connected to Gajabrishta through the name itself, as "Gaja" in Sanskrit means elephant, and "Brishta" refers to the back or hip portion of a sitting elephant. The later Cholas of the Chola empire in the Indian subcontinent, particularly in Thondai Mandalam around North Tamil Nadu, constructed temples with vimanas in this style, specifically in the sanctum sanctorum of Shiva temples.
